definition: The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote

sentences.english: Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody.
sentences.chinese: 事過境遷，物是人非，不因任何人停留。

sentences.english: The whole matter is dead and buried and I don't want you to mention it again.
sentences.chinese: 整件事已經事過境遷了，我不希望你再提起來。

sentences.english: But times have changed, and the Web is now big business.
sentences.chinese: 事過境遷，現在的互聯網業已是一個新形的產業。

sentences.english: During the interview, she revealed that she cried her heart out every night when she was alone.
sentences.chinese: 事過境遷，她接受專訪時透露其實在人後卻哭成淚人。

sentences.english: I don't want you to mention it again.
sentences.chinese: 整件事已經事過境遷了，我不希望你再提起來。

sentences.english: Don't cry because it's over now, laugh because it happened.
sentences.chinese: 別爲事過境遷而哭泣，要爲曾經擁有而高興。

definition: restrain your grief, accept fate (condolence phrase)
to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
to waste time on worthless activities
to enjoy the present (idiom); to live happily with no thought for the future/make merry while you can/carpe diem
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to dispel (enmity, misunderstandings etc)/to vanish (of misgivings, differences of opinion)/thaw (in relations)
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
